operations.summary: Get the stats for a specified Protection Domain.
operations.notes: If start time and end time are included in the query string, then historical stats are retrieved. Otherwise, the latest stats are retrieved.

operations.summary: Delete a Protection Domain.
operations.notes: Mark a Protection domain for removal. Protection domain will be removed from the cluster when all outstanding operations on it are cancelled.

operations.summary: Get a Protection Domain.
operations.notes: Get a Protection Domain with the specified name.

parameters.name: metroAvail
parameters.description: Whether to include only Metro Availability related protection domains

operations.summary: Get the list of alerts generated on a specified Protection Domain.

operations.summary: Updates Consistency Group for a specific protection domain.
operations.notes: Updates Consistency Group for a specific protection domain.

operations.summary: Deactivate a protection domain.
operations.notes: Deactivate a protection domain with the specified name. If you delete this protection domain after this, it will destroy all the VMs and VGs protected in this protection domain.

operations.summary: Migrate an active Protection Domain to a DR site.
operations.notes: Mark the specified Protection domain as inactive and failover to the given Remote Site.

parameters.description: Flag to specify whether mobility check has to be skipped

operations.notes: Add a out of band(i.e one time) snapshot schedule in a Protection Domain having specified name.

operations.notes: Clear retention policies of specified snapshot scheudule from the specified Protection Domain.

operations.summary: Set retention policies of a snapshot schedule of a Protection Domain.
operations.notes: Set retention policies of specified snapshot schedule from the specified Protection Domain.

operations.summary: Restore Virtual Machines and/or NFS files.
operations.notes:
Restore Virtual Machines and/or NFS files in a Protection Domain to a given Snapshot. This returns a ‘File Group UUID’ through which the restored entities can be managed. The assumption is that such restored entities are short lived and have to be deleted explicitly. The APIs under ‘/file_groups’ namespace provide such management APIs.

Note that this API addresses a narrower use case and many users of Prism might not find it useful.

operations.summary: Remove Virtual Machines from a Protection Domain.
Delete a snapshot.
operations.notes: Delete a snapshot of a Protection Domain.

operations.summary: Retain a snapshot.
operations.notes: Retain a snapshot of a Protection Domain.

parameters.description: Retention time in microseconds, If value is less thanthe current epoch time in microseconds, then it will delete this snapshot. To retain a snapshot forever give null or no value in the payload

operations.summary: Abort a replication.
operations.notes: Abort a replication in a Protection Domain.

operations.summary: Update the state of the replication.
operations.notes: Update the state of the replication in a Protection Domain.

parameters.description: One of pause, resume or abort

isRollupSched.description: Given schedule is a Rollup Schedule or not

rollupScheduleUuid.description: UUID that helps identify that cron schedules are part of a rollup schedule.

timezoneOffset.description: Timezone offset in seconds w.r.t GMT in which the start time is being specified. Defaults to 0, which is GMT

timeout.description: Timeout to break replication when primary does not hear back from secondary for the amount of time

nfsFiles.description: Names of NFS files to be restored
nfsFiles.notes: Names of NFS files to be restored.

pathPrefix.description: Path prefix to be applied for cloning VMs. It is recommended to not use path_prefix while restoring a virtual machine or volume group.
pathPrefix.notes: Path prefix to be applied for cloning VMs.

snapshotId.description: Id of the snapshot to restore entities from.
snapshotId.notes: Id of the snapshot to restore entities from.

vgNamePrefix.description: Name prefix to be applied for cloning VGs.
vgNamePrefix.notes: Name prefix to be applied for cloning VGs.

vmNamePrefix.description: Name prefix to be applied for cloning VMs.
vmNamePrefix.notes: Name prefix to be applied for cloning VMs.

vmNames.description: Names of VM to be restored.
vmNames.notes: Names of VM to be restored.

volumeGroupUuids.description: UUIDs of Volume Groups to be restored
volumeGroupUuids.notes: UUIDs of Volume Groups to be restored.

localRetentionPeriod.description: Maximum number of days/weeks/months a snapshot is to be retained locally.

localRetentionType.description: Retention type for local Snapshots i.e. DAYS/ WEEKS/ MONTHS/ NUM_SNAPSHOTS

remoteRetentionPeriod.description: Maximum number of days/weeks/months a remote snapshot is to be retained remotely.

remoteRetentionType.description: Retention type for remote Snapshots i.e. DAYS/ WEEKS/ MONTHS/ NUM_SNAPSHOTS

appConsistentSnapshots.description: Whether consistency group performs app consistent snapshots

vmHandle.description: Internal data-structure used by Cerebro to uniquely identify a vm Should it be displayed to user?

vmId.description: Unique identifier of a virtual machine within a Hypervisor.

vmPowerStateOnRecovery.description: Power state after vm recovery. Default power state is POWEREDOFF.
enum: Power state at time of snapshot

actions.description: Possible actions to resolve this alert

chartQueries.description: Charts that are relevant to this cause

hasGlobalDetails.description: Whether the alert has global details or not

numResolvedCount.description: Number of times this cause has resolved the alert

parentCauseId.description: Id of the alert/cause this is a possible cause for

troubleshootingSteps.description: Steps to determine whether this is the cause.

severity.description: This field describes the severity of the alert.

metricDetails.description: List of metric details associated with the alert
metricDetails.notes: List of metric details associated with the alert

severity.description: Severity level of the alert. Can be INFO, WARNING or CRITICAL
